I'll come up with an all-encompassing definition of motion for you, which you can apply in any scenario and get adequate results. We say that an object is in motion when the surroundings of the object (everything surrounding the object) changes position from time to time (with respect to the object). For instance, I'm (at present) laying down on my bed and typing this answer (was actually sleeping. Woke up because of this notification ring. Lol). Anyways. So at present, I'm laying down on my bed. So you would say that I'm at rest. But no. I'm still at motion. Because everything surrounding me (my bed, my planet, my planet's sun, my planet's sun's cloud of stars etc) that is, EVERYTHING surrounding me are moving (changing position from time to time) with respect to me. And thus, I'm not at rest, but instead, in motion always. But yes, if you consider my planet only, then am at rest. Thank you. Happy reading. Ardhendu Chakraborty.
